question.title: Float annoys in Java for 17721.415
question.body:
package net.smart;

public class Bakwas{

    public static void main(String[] args){

        float f = 17721.415f;

        System.out.println(f);

   }

}

the output is 17721.414 not 17721.415 problem we have is that in a calculation we have 149.75 hrs and the rate is 118.34 and the values accepted are 17721.415, 17721.416 and 17721.42 by a webservice but since the value of 17721.414 is sent it is turned down.

This I see in my runtimes Java 8, 17 and 21

I am concatenating the decimal point up to 2nd decimal with the third decimal point and then it works as 17721.416 please explain why and give any other fix

I know I could use double but after any if I need to assign this value to a floating point variable then again even on that casting it again prints 17721.414
